title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@posit.co. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

what: Run R CMD check from R and Capture Results
title: Run R CMD check from R and Capture Results
text: Installation Usage

title: Run R CMD check from R and Capture Results
text: Run R CMD check R Capture Results Run R CMD check R programmatically capture results individual checks.

title: Run R CMD check from R and Capture Results
text: Install released version CRAN install development version GitHub:
code: install.packages("rcmdcheck") # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("r-lib/rcmdcheck")

title: Run R CMD check from R and Capture Results
text: Call rcmdcheck() source R package .tar.gz file, folder containing R package. Supply quiet = FALSE want omit output. result check returned, list elements errors, warnings, notes. element character vector, one element character vectors single failure.
code: library(rcmdcheck) rcmdcheck("path/to/R/package")

title: Run R CMD check from R and Capture Results
text: rcmdcheck() returns rcmdcheck object, can query manipulate. check_details() turns check results simple lists following information currently: package: Package name. version: Package version number. notes: Character vector check NOTEs. warnings: Character vector check WARNINGs. errors: Character vector check ERRORs. platform: Platform, e.g. x86_64-apple-darwin15.6.0. checkdir: Check directory. install_out: Output package installation. description: text DESCRIPTION file. session_info: sessioninfo::session_info object, session information within check process. cran: Flag, whether CRAN package. (Based Repository field DESCRIPTION, typically set published CRAN packages.) bioc: Flag, whether Bioconductor package, based presence biocViews field DESCRIPTION. Note check results parsed file, fields might missing (NULL), don’t access original DESCRIPTION, installation output, etc.
code: library(rcmdcheck) chk <- rcmdcheck("tests/testthat/bad1", quiet = TRUE) chk #> ── R CMD check results ─────────────────────────────────── badpackage 1.0.0 ──── #> Duration: 9.7s #>  #> ❯ checking DESCRIPTION meta-information ... WARNING #>   Non-standard license specification: #>     Public domain #>   Standardizable: FALSE #>  #> 0 errors ✔ | 1 warning ✖ | 0 notes ✔ names(check_details(chk)) #>  [1] "package"      "version"      "notes"        "warnings"     "errors"       #>  [6] "platform"     "checkdir"     "install_out"  "description"  "session_info" #> [11] "cran"         "bioc"

title: Run R CMD check from R and Capture Results
text: parse_check() parses check output file, parse_check_url() parses check output URL.

title: Run R CMD check from R and Capture Results
text: rcmdcheck functions access CRAN’s package check results. cran_check_flavours() downloads names CRAN platforms: cran_check_results() loads parses check results package.
code: cran_check_flavours() #>  [1] "r-devel-linux-x86_64-debian-clang" "r-devel-linux-x86_64-debian-gcc"   #>  [3] "r-devel-linux-x86_64-fedora-clang" "r-devel-linux-x86_64-fedora-gcc"   #>  [5] "r-devel-windows-x86_64"            "r-patched-linux-x86_64"            #>  [7] "r-release-linux-x86_64"            "r-release-macos-arm64"             #>  [9] "r-release-macos-x86_64"            "r-release-windows-x86_64"          #> [11] "r-oldrel-macos-arm64"              "r-oldrel-macos-x86_64"             #> [13] "r-oldrel-windows-ix86+x86_64" cran_check_results("igraph") #> $`r-devel-linux-x86_64-debian-clang` #> ── R CMD check results ─────────────────────────────────────── igraph 1.4.1 ──── #> Duration: 0ms #>  #> 0 errors ✔ | 0 warnings ✔ | 0 notes ✔ #>  #> $`r-devel-linux-x86_64-debian-gcc` #> ── R CMD check results ─────────────────────────────────────── igraph 1.4.1 ──── #> Duration: 0ms #>  #> 0 errors ✔ | 0 warnings ✔ | 0 notes ✔ #>  #> $`r-devel-linux-x86_64-fedora-clang` #> ── R CMD check results ─────────────────────────────────────── igraph 1.4.1 ──── #> Duration: 0ms #>  #> ❯ checking installed package size ... NOTE #>     installed size is  7.2Mb #>     sub-directories of 1Mb or more: #>       R      1.4Mb #>       help   1.4Mb #>       libs   3.3Mb #>  #> 0 errors ✔ | 0 warnings ✔ | 1 note ✖ #>  #> $`r-devel-linux-x86_64-fedora-gcc` #> ── R CMD check results ─────────────────────────────────────── igraph 1.4.1 ──── #> Duration: 0ms #>  #> 0 errors ✔ | 0 warnings ✔ | 0 notes ✔ #>  #> $`r-patched-linux-x86_64` #> ── R CMD check results ─────────────────────────────────────── igraph 1.4.1 ──── #> Duration: 0ms #>  #> 0 errors ✔ | 0 warnings ✔ | 0 notes ✔ #>  #> $`r-release-linux-x86_64` #> ── R CMD check results ─────────────────────────────────────── igraph 1.4.1 ──── #> Duration: 0ms #>  #> 0 errors ✔ | 0 warnings ✔ | 0 notes ✔ #>  #> $`r-release-macos-arm64` #> ── R CMD check results ─────────────────────────────────────── igraph 1.4.1 ──── #> Duration: 0ms #>  #> ❯ checking installed package size ... NOTE #>     installed size is 19.9Mb #>     sub-directories of 1Mb or more: #>       R      2.1Mb #>       help   1.4Mb #>       libs  15.4Mb #>  #> 0 errors ✔ | 0 warnings ✔ | 1 note ✖ #>  #> $`r-release-macos-x86_64` #> ── R CMD check results ─────────────────────────────────────── igraph 1.4.1 ──── #> Duration: 0ms #>  #> ❯ checking installed package size ... NOTE #>     installed size is 18.5Mb #>     sub-directories of 1Mb or more: #>       R      1.4Mb #>       help   1.4Mb #>       libs  14.6Mb #>  #> 0 errors ✔ | 0 warnings ✔ | 1 note ✖ #>  #> $`r-release-windows-x86_64` #> ── R CMD check results ─────────────────────────────────────── igraph 1.4.1 ──── #> Duration: 0ms #>  #> ❯ checking installed package size ... NOTE #>     installed size is 10.3Mb #>     sub-directories of 1Mb or more: #>       R      1.4Mb #>       help   1.4Mb #>       libs   6.4Mb #>  #> 0 errors ✔ | 0 warnings ✔ | 1 note ✖ #>  #> $`r-oldrel-macos-arm64` #> ── R CMD check results ─────────────────────────────────────── igraph 1.4.1 ──── #> Duration: 0ms #>  #> ❯ checking installed package size ... NOTE #>     installed size is 19.9Mb #>     sub-directories of 1Mb or more: #>       R      2.0Mb #>       help   1.4Mb #>       libs  15.4Mb #>  #> 0 errors ✔ | 0 warnings ✔ | 1 note ✖ #>  #> $`r-oldrel-macos-x86_64` #> ── R CMD check results ─────────────────────────────────────── igraph 1.4.1 ──── #> Duration: 0ms #>  #> ❯ checking installed package size ... NOTE #>     installed size is 18.5Mb #>     sub-directories of 1Mb or more: #>       R      1.4Mb #>       help   1.4Mb #>       libs  14.6Mb #>  #> 0 errors ✔ | 0 warnings ✔ | 1 note ✖ #>  #> $`r-oldrel-windows-ix86+x86_64` #> ── R CMD check results ─────────────────────────────────────── igraph 1.4.1 ──── #> Duration: 0ms #>  #> ❯ checking installed package size ... NOTE #>     installed size is 17.2Mb #>     sub-directories of 1Mb or more: #>       R      1.4Mb #>       help   1.4Mb #>       libs  13.4Mb #>  #> 0 errors ✔ | 0 warnings ✔ | 1 note ✖ #>  #> attr(,"package") #> [1] "igraph" #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "rmcdcheck_cran_results"

title: Run R CMD check from R and Capture Results
text: compare_checks() can compare two rcmdcheck objects. compare_to_cran() compares rcmdcheck object CRAN checks package:
code: chk <- rcmdcheck(quiet = TRUE) compare_to_cran(chk) #> ── R CMD check comparison ──────────────────── rcmdcheck 1.4.0 / 1.4.0.9000 ──── #> Status: OK

title: Run R CMD check from R and Capture Results
text: rcmdcheck_process processx::process class, can run R CMD check background. can also use run multiple checks concurrently. processx::process methods can used poll manipulate check processes.
code: chkpx <- rcmdcheck_process$new() chkpx #> PROCESS 'R', running, pid 25919. chkpx$wait() chkpx$parse_results() #> ── R CMD check results ─────────────────────────────── rcmdcheck 1.4.0.9000 ──── #> Duration: 16.8s #>  #> 0 errors ✔ | 0 warnings ✔ | 0 notes ✔

title: Query R CMD check results and parameters — check_details
text: named list elements: package: package name. version: package version. rversion: R version. notes: character vector check NOTEs, NOTE element. warnings: character vector check WARNINGs, WARNING element. errors: character vector check ERRORs, ERROR element. check timeout adds ERROR vector. platform: check platform checkdir: check directory. install_out: output installation, contents 00install.file. single string. description: contents DESCRIPTION file package. single string. session_info: output sessioninfo::session_info(), R session performing checks. checkdir: path check directory, cleaned yet, NA. check directory automatically cleaned , check object deleted (garbage collected). cran: whether CRAN packaged package. bioc: whether BioConductor package.

title: rcmdcheck configuration — rcmdcheck-config
text: Options take precedence environment variables. E.g. RCMDCHECK_NUM_COLORS environment variables rcmdcheck.num_colors option set, latter used.

title: rcmdcheck configuration — rcmdcheck-config
text: rcmdcheck uses cli package much output, can configure output via cli, see cli::cli-config. Package configration defined DESCRIPTION file checked package. E.g.:
code: Config/build/clean-inst-doc: FALSE

title: rcmdcheck configuration — rcmdcheck-config
text: R_PROFILE_USER: standard R environment variable configure path user level R profile. See base::R_PROFILE_USER. RCMDCHECK_BASE_URL: URL root CRAN check web page. can use select alternative CRAN mirror. Defaults https://cran.r-project.org/web/checks/. RCMDCHECK_DETAILS_URL: URL root CRAN check output page. Defaults https://www.r-project.org/nosvn/R.check/. RCMDCHECK_ERROR_ON: default value error_on argument rcmdcheck(). RCMDCHECK_FLAVOURS_URL URL CRAN check flavours page. can use select alternative CRAN mirror. Defaults https://cran.r-project.org/web/checks/check_flavors.html. RCMDCHECK_NUM_COLORS: number ANSI colors use output. can used override number colors detected configured cli package. See cli::num_ansi_colors(). configuration used output rcmdcheck affect examples test cases (code) checked package. set, default cli uesed. corresponding option rcmdcheck.num_colors. RCMDCHECK_TIMESTAMP_LIMIT: lower limit seconds, rcmdcheck adds time stamps individual check steps. may fractional. Defaults 1/3 second. corresponding option rcmdcheck.timestamp_limit. RCMDCHECK_USE_RSTUDIO_PANDOC: Flag (true false). true, rcmdcheck always puts RStudio's pandoc (available) path. false, never . set, set different value, pandoc put path already available. RStudio's pandoc detected via RSTUDIO_PANDOC environment variable. RCMDCHECK_LOAD_CHECK_ENV: can use environment variable suppress loading environment variables tools/check.env file. See rcmdcheck() details. RSTUDIO_PANDOC: set, rcmdcheck adds environment variable PATH pandoc PATH already. usually set RStudio. See also RCMDCHECK_USE_RSTUDIO_PANDOC environment variable.

title: rcmdcheck configuration — rcmdcheck-config
text: rcmdcheck.num_colors: number ANSI colors use output. can used override number colors detected configured cli package. See cli::num_ansi_colors(). configuration used output rcmdcheck affect examples test cases (code) checked package. set, default cli uesed. corresponding environment variable RCMDCHECK_NUM_COLORS. rcmdcheck.test_output: Flag (TRUE FALSE), whether print.rcmdcheck() print full test output test failures. tests fail, failures printed, independently option. rcmdcheck.timestamp_limit: lower limit seconds, rcmdcheck adds time stamps individual check steps. may fractional. Defaults 1/3 second. corresponding environment variable RCMDCHECK_TIMESTAMP_LIMIT.

title: rcmdcheck configuration — rcmdcheck-config
text: Config/build/clean-inst-doc: Flag (TRUE FALSE) specify inst/doc directory cleaned building package directory. specified, NULL used. See clean_doc option pkgbuild::build() details.

what: Run R CMD check from R and Capture Results — rcmdcheck
title: Run R CMD check from R and Capture Results — rcmdcheck
text: Run R CMD check R programmatically, capture results individual checks. Runs R CMD check external command, parses output returns check failures.

title: Run R CMD check from R and Capture Results — rcmdcheck
code: rcmdcheck(   path = ".",   quiet = FALSE,   args = character(),   build_args = character(),   check_dir = NULL,   libpath = .libPaths(),   repos = getOption("repos"),   timeout = Inf,   error_on = Sys.getenv("RCMDCHECK_ERROR_ON", c("never", "error", "warning", "note")[1]),   env = character() )

title: Run R CMD check from R and Capture Results — rcmdcheck
text: path Path package tarball directory. quiet Whether print check output checking. args Character vector arguments pass R CMD check. Pass argument single element character vector (use spaces delimit arguments like shell). example, skip running examples tests, use args = c("---examples", "---tests") args = "---examples ---tests". (Note instead --output option use check_dir argument,  --output deal spaces special characters Windows.) build_args Character vector arguments pass R CMD build. Pass argument single element character vector (use spaces delimit arguments like shell). example, build_args = c("--force", "--keep-empty-dirs") correct usage build_args = "--force --keep-empty-dirs" incorrect. check_dir Path directory check performed. path created needed reported checkdir field object returned rcmdcheck(). check_dir = NULL (default), check performed temporary directory automatically cleaned object returned rcmdcheck() deleted. libpath library path set check. default uses current library path. repos repos option set check. needed cyclic dependency checks use ---cran argument. default uses current value. timeout Timeout check, seconds, base::difftime object. finished , killed. Inf means timeout. check timed , added extra error result object. error_on Whether throw error R CMD check failures. Note check always completed (unless timeout happens), error thrown completion. "never", errors thrown. "error", ERROR failures generate errors. "warning", WARNING failures generate errors well. "note", check failure generated error. default can modified RCMDCHECK_ERROR_ON environment variable. set, "never" used. env named character vector, extra environment variables set check process.

title: Run R CMD check from R and Capture Results — rcmdcheck
text: S3 object (list) fields errors, warnings notes. character vectors containing output failed check.

title: Run R CMD check from R and Capture Results — rcmdcheck
text: See rcmdcheck_process need run R CMD check background process.

title: Run R CMD check from R and Capture Results — rcmdcheck
text: Sometimes useful programmatically turn checks may report check NOTEs. rcmdcheck provides two ways . First, may declare DESCRIPTION want see NOTEs accepted CRAN, entry:   Currently, make rcmdcheck ignore following notes: report large package sizes (_R_CHECK_PKG_SIZES_ = FALSE), check cross-references Rd files (_R_CHECK_RD_XREFS_ = FALSE), NOTE package requires GNU make (_R_CHECK_CRAN_INCOMING_NOTE_GNU_MAKE_ = FALSE), report marked non-ASCII strings datasets (_R_CHECK_PACKAGE_DATASETS_SUPPRESS_NOTES_ = TRUE). second way flexible, lets turn individual checks via setting environment variables. may provide tools/check.env environment file package list environment variable settings rcmdcheck automatically use checking package. See Startup format file. example tools/check.env file:   See "R internals" manual R source code environment variables control checks. Note Config/rcmdcheck/ignore-inconsequential-notes check.env file supported rcmdcheck, running R CMD check shell (GUI) use .
code: Config/rcmdcheck/ignore-inconsequential-notes: true # Report if package size is larger than 10 megabytes _R_CHECK_PKG_SIZES_THRESHOLD_=10  # Do not check Rd cross references _R_CHECK_RD_XREFS_=false  # Do not report if package requires GNU make _R_CHECK_CRAN_INCOMING_NOTE_GNU_MAKE_=false  # Do not check non-ASCII strings in datasets _R_CHECK_PACKAGE_DATASETS_SUPPRESS_NOTES_=true

what: Run an R CMD check process in the background — rcmdcheck_process
title: Run an R CMD check process in the background — rcmdcheck_process
text: rcmdcheck_process R6 class, extends callr::rcmd_process class (turn extends processx::process.

title: Run an R CMD check process in the background — rcmdcheck_process
text: methods inherited callr::rcmd_process processx::process. Note calling get_output_connection get_error_connection method good idea, stdout /stderr process collected parse_results(). can still use read_output_lines() read_error_lines() methods read standard output error, parse_results() affected .
code: cp <- rcmdcheck_process$new(path = ".", args = character(),          build_args = character(), check_dir = NULL,          libpath = .libPaths(), repos = getOption("repos"))  cp$parse_results()

title: Run an R CMD check process in the background — rcmdcheck_process
text: cp: new rcmdcheck_process object. path: Path package tree package archive file. package check. args: Command line arguments R CMD check. build_args: Command line arguments R CMD build. check_dir: Directory results. libpath: library path set check. repos: repos option set check. needed cyclic dependency checks use ---cran argument. default uses current value. env: named character vector, extra environment variables set check process.

title: Run an R CMD check process in the background — rcmdcheck_process
text: methods inherited callr::rcmd_process processx::process. cp$parse_results() parses results, returns S3 object fields errors, warnnigs notes, just like rcmdcheck(). error call process finished. Use wait() method wait check finish, is_alive() method check still running.

title: Open the check directory in a file browser window — xopen.rcmdcheck

title: Open the check directory in a file browser window — xopen.rcmdcheck
text: target rcmdcheck() result. app Specify app open target , arguments, character vector. Note app names platform dependent. quiet Whether echo command screen, running . ... Additional arguments, used currently.

title: rcmdcheck (development version)
text: Fixed issue check output malformed testing packages multiple test files (#205, @kevinushey). Update pkgdown template move url https://rcmdcheck.r-lib.org.

title: rcmdcheck 1.4.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-09-27 cran_check_results() now downloads results parallel, much faster. rcmdcheck_process now redirects standard error standard output, make sure correctly interleaved (#148). rcmdcheck now puts Rtools PATH, via pkgbuild (#111). rcmdcheck now builds manual building package, needed \Sexpr{} expressions (#137). version fixes rare race condition made rcmdcheck fail (#139). rcmdcheck now safeguards R deleting user’s home directory via R CMD build bug (#120). rcmdcheck can now ignore files inst/doc building package. See Config/build/clean-inst-doc package option ?"rcmdcheck-config" (#130). now possible turn /ANSI colors rcmdcheck , without affecting checked package. See ?"rcmdcheck-config" theRCMDCHECK_NUM_COLORSenvironment variable thercmdcheck.num_colors` option (#119, @jimhester). print.rcmdcheck() now test_output argument rcmdcheck.test_output global option, control whether print full test output . (#121) RStudio’s Pandoc now path rcmdcheck() rcmdcheck_process (#109, #132, @dpprdan). rcmdcheck() now errors check process crashes (#110, #163). rcmdcheck() prints check ouptut better interactively, especially package multiple test files (#145, #161). rcmdcheck can now ignore NOTEs, requested, see ?rcmdcheck details (#12, #160). rcmdcheck now always converts output UTF-8 native encoding. also handles parsing check output non-native encoding better (#152). rcmdcheck now ignored time stamps comparing two check results (#128). rcmdcheck now print extra empty lines interactive output GitHub Actions. rcmdcheck now uses robust implementation extract session info check process (#164).

title: rcmdcheck 1.3.3
text: CRAN release: 2019-05-07 cran_check_results() now quiet argument, download progress bars shown set FALSE (#17). Fix output standard output support \r, typically terminal (#94). Fix standard output standard error mixup test cases, (#88, #96). Fix parsing test failures multiple architectures checked, (#97). rcmdcheck() now better colors. WARNINGs magenta, NOTEs blue (#103, @hadley).

title: rcmdcheck 1.3.2
text: CRAN release: 2018-11-10 rcmdcheck() now correctly overwrites existing tarballs already exist check directory. time real.

title: rcmdcheck 1.3.1
text: CRAN release: 2018-11-05 rcmdcheck() now correctly overwrites existing tarballs already exist check directory (#84 @jimhester). rcmdcheck now uses sessioninfo::session_info() query session information check.

title: rcmdcheck 1.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2018-09-19 New rcmdcheck_process class run R CMD check background. rcmdcheck() now supports timeouts (default 10 minutes). Checks now capture print installation test failures. Checks now record print duration check. Checks now record print session information check session (#22). rcmdcheck() new keep files returned check object deleted, check run temporary directory (default) (#23). New xopen() show check file file browser window (#61). Checks now save install.also DESCRIPTION result, save standard error exit status well. rcmdcheck() printing now better: message check actually performed shown screen. rcmdcheck() now shows spinner running check. rcmdcheck() results now summary() method check comparisons. rcmdcheck() results now new check_details() method, query check results programmatically. (need use $errors, $warnings, etc. directly.) Checks now find package root automatically (#18). rcmdcheck() now error_on argument throw error R CMD check failure (#51). rcmdcheck() result printing now better, colors consistent (#54).

title: rcmdcheck 1.2.1
text: CRAN release: 2016-09-28 Compare two check results compare_checks compare check results CRAN compare_to_cran. result object metadata: package name, version, R version platform. Refined printing result. rcmdcheck() works tarballs build via R CMD build now. Parse R CMD check results: parse_check, parse_check_url. Download parse check results CRAN packages. Report errors build, typically vignette errors. Use callr package (https://github.com/r-lib/callr) running R CMD commands.

title: rcmdcheck 1.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2016-04-16 New arguments libpath repos set library path default CRAN repository run tests CRAN.

title: rcmdcheck 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2016-03-28 First public release.
